intro: Porocystis toulicioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is native to regions of Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid environments. Porocystis toulicioides is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
